intro: Eurystyles luisortizii, commonly known as the Luis Ortiz's spurge, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
